<ce:section-title>Syntheses</ce:section-title><ce:section-title>{[Co<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(BTC)(OH)(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>]<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>
<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>·<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>2H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O}<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf> (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">The best crystals of complex <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> were prepared from a reaction mixture of Co (OAc)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>
<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>·<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>2H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (0.08<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g), 1,2,4-benzenetricarboxylate (0.08<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g) in 6<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml of water. The starting mixture was adjusted to pH 7 by the addition of 1<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>M NaOH under vigorous stirring. The final solution was transferred into a 23<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL Teflon-lined autoclave and crystallized at 160<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C for 4 days. After slowly cooling at 10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C/h to room temperature, the red block crystals were collected by filtration and air-dried (yield: 47% based on Co). Anal. Calcd. For complex <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>: C, 27.29% H, 2.53% Co, 29.78% Found: C, 27.60% H, 2.81% N, 29.62%. Selected FTIR data (cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3659(m), 3592(m), 3384(m), 1617(s), 1557(s), 1497(s), 1431(s), 1405(s), 1259(v), 1181(v), 1079(v), 865(v), 823(s), 777(m), 724(m), 673(m), 631(v), 520(m).</ce:para><ce:section-title>{Co<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(NA)<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)}<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf> (<ce:bold>2</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">The best crystals of complex <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> were prepared from a reaction mixture of Co (OAc)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>
<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>·<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>2H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (0.10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g), NA (0.12<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g 0.50 mmol) and 6<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O, stirred for 30<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>min, and then the pH value was adjusted to 6 with 1<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>M NaOH. After stirring for another 30<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>min, the mixture was transferred to a 23ml Teflon-lined stainless steel bomb and kept at 160<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C under autogenous pressure for 4 days. The reaction system was cooled to room temperature during 24<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>h. A large amount of red block crystals of <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> were obtained. Yield: 54% (base on Co). Anal. Calcd. for complex <ce:bold>2</ce:bold>: C, 46.13% H, 2.96% N, 8.89% Co, 17.75%. Found: C, 46.30% H, 2.81% N, 8.62% Co, 17.79%. IR: 3315(m), 1616(w), 1591(s), 1543(s), 1476(w), 1447(w), 1411(s), 1311(w), 1284(w), 1159(w), 1113(w), 1006(w), 1000(w), 989(w), 957(w), 858(w), 843(w), 755(m), 712(m), 680(w), 607(w), 541 (w).</ce:para>
clean_text:
Syntheses

{[Co2(BTC)(OH)(H2O)2]2 ⋅2H2O}n (1)

The best crystals of complex 1 were prepared from a reaction mixture of Co (OAc)2 ⋅2H2O (0.08g), 1,2,4-benzenetricarboxylate (0.08g) in 6ml of water. The starting mixture was adjusted to pH 7 by the addition of 1M NaOH under vigorous stirring. The final solution was transferred into a 23mL Teflon-lined autoclave and crystallized at 160°C for 4 days. After slowly cooling at 10°C/h to room temperature, the red block crystals were collected by filtration and air-dried (yield: 47% based on Co). Anal. Calcd. For complex 1: C, 27.29% H, 2.53% Co, 29.78% Found: C, 27.60% H, 2.81% N, 29.62%. Selected FTIR data (cm-1): 3659(m), 3592(m), 3384(m), 1617(s), 1557(s), 1497(s), 1431(s), 1405(s), 1259(v), 1181(v), 1079(v), 865(v), 823(s), 777(m), 724(m), 673(m), 631(v), 520(m).

{Co2(NA)4(H2O)}n (2)

The best crystals of complex 2 were prepared from a reaction mixture of Co (OAc)2 ⋅2H2O (0.10g), NA (0.12g 0.50 mmol) and 6ml H2O, stirred for 30min, and then the pH value was adjusted to 6 with 1M NaOH. After stirring for another 30min, the mixture was transferred to a 23ml Teflon-lined stainless steel bomb and kept at 160°C under autogenous pressure for 4 days. The reaction system was cooled to room temperature during 24h. A large amount of red block crystals of 2 were obtained. Yield: 54% (base on Co). Anal. Calcd. for complex 2: C, 46.13% H, 2.96% N, 8.89% Co, 17.75%. Found: C, 46.30% H, 2.81% N, 8.62% Co, 17.79%. IR: 3315(m), 1616(w), 1591(s), 1543(s), 1476(w), 1447(w), 1411(s), 1311(w), 1284(w), 1159(w), 1113(w), 1006(w), 1000(w), 989(w), 957(w), 858(w), 843(w), 755(m), 712(m), 680(w), 607(w), 541 (w).
